metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5621 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The snmp_pdu_parse function in snmp_api.c in net-snmp 5.7.2 and earlier does not remove the varBind variable in a netsnmp_variable_list item when parsing of the SNMP PDU fails, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5621` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
libsnmp-perl - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
libsnmp30 - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
python-netsnmp - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
snmp - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
snmpd - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
tkmib - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1').
